data.text:
About the CURE Children’s Hospital of Zimbabwe

Established in April 2021, CURE Zimbabwe is the first and only hospital in the country of 14 million people to provide orthopaedic care for disabilities such as clubfoot, bowed legs, and knock knees to children regardless of their economic status. The teaching hospital has 18 beds, three operating theatres, and an outpatient clinic. The hospital was refurbished by the Zimbabwe Orthopaedic Trust in partnership with the Zimbabwean government and is located adjacent to United Bulawayo Hospital in Bulawayo.

Staff

Meet Executive Director Jonathan Simpson and more of the amazing staff that work at CURE Zimbabwe.

Staff Profiles

Zimbabwe Facts

Over 300,000 children are currently living with treatable conditions such as neglected clubfoot, bowed legs and knock knees.

Currently there are 1.6 physicians and 7.2 nurses for evey 10,000 people.

About 53% of people living with disability in Zimbabwe became disabled before the age of twenty.

CURE Children’s Hospital of Zimbabwe

Opened: 2021

Specialty: Reconstructive Paediatric Orthopaedic Surgery

Annual outpatient visits: 2,706 (FY2022)

Annual procedures: 687 (FY2022)
